intro: Phyllanthus kiangsiensis, commonly known as the Kiangsi spurge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. It produces a milky sap that is a common feature of the genus Phyllanthus. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
